title: North Wales Budget Weekend
suitableFor: Active individuals, couples, or small groups looking for an affordable outdoor adventure. Some hiking experience is beneficial.
notSuitableFor: Those with mobility issues, a strong aversion to camping, or those seeking luxury accommodations and fine dining.

stops.title: Torrent Walk, Dolgellau
stops.description: A stunning walk alongside a cascading river through a wooded gorge, with several waterfalls.

wetAlt.title: King Arthur's Labyrinth
wetAlt.description: An underground storytelling adventure exploring Welsh legends.

budgetAlt.title: Continue along the Mawddach Trail
budgetAlt.description: A flat, easy walk or cycle along the estuary. Park in Dolgellau and follow signs.

stops.title: Bistro @ Cymer
stops.description: Friendly cafe offering light bites, sandwiches and cakes. Located close to the Torrent Walk.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Glaslyn Osprey Project viewpoint
budgetAlt.description: A great spot to enjoy your lunch and hopefully see Ospreys (seasonal)

stops.title: Wild Swimming in Llyn Dinas
stops.description: A refreshing dip in a beautiful mountain lake with views of Snowdon. Be mindful of water temperature.

wetAlt.title: National Slate Museum, Llanberis
wetAlt.description: Explore the history of the Welsh slate industry.

budgetAlt.title: Relax by the lake and enjoy the views.
budgetAlt.description: Perfect for reading, sketching, or simply taking in the scenery.

stops.title: Camping at Llyn Gwynant Campsite
stops.description: A scenic campsite in the heart of Snowdonia with good facilities. Ideal for budget travellers.

budgetAlt.title: Wild camping (ensure legal and responsible)
budgetAlt.description: Check regulations and leave no trace.

stops.title: Coed y Brenin Forest Park - MinorTaur Trail
stops.description: A free family-friendly mountain bike trail. Bike hire available nearby.

wetAlt.title: Coed y Brenin Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Explore the exhibits and enjoy a coffee in the cafe.

budgetAlt.title: Hiking Trails at Coed y Brenin
budgetAlt.description: Numerous hiking trails of varying difficulty are available.

stops.title: Cafe at Coed y Brenin Visitor Centre
stops.description: Basic cafe with sandwiches, hot dogs and cakes.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at the Coed y Brenin picnic area
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own food with views of the forest.

stops.title: Explore Swallow Falls
stops.description: Visit the highest continuous waterfall in Wales. Small entry fee applies.

wetAlt.title: Browse the shops in Betws-y-Coed
wetAlt.description: Explore the gift shops and outdoor clothing stores.

budgetAlt.title: Walk the riverside path in Betws-y-Coed (free)
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the scenic riverside walk without entering the falls area

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: North Wales weather can be unpredictable. Be prepared for rain even in summer. Mountain weather can change rapidly.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy in Snowdonia, especially during peak season (July/August) and on weekends. Allow extra time for travel and parking, especially around popular attractions like Snowdon. Parking at Swallow Falls can be difficult, especially during peak times.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Camping reservations are recommended, especially during peak season. Some activities, like King Arthur's Labyrinth, may require advance booking.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: Moderate fitness is required for the hiking and mountain biking activities. The Torrent Walk involves some steep steps and uneven terrain.
